body:
Rclone has 

      --stats-file-name-length int               Max file name length in stats. 0 for no limit (default 40)

which can make the names of the files longer.

I'm not sure we will ever satisfy everyone here as squeezing > 40 chars into 40 characters always means leaving out something!

I didn't know this option. Will help.
Sure you will always leave something out but if you have the beginning of the file's name and the end, that would help

Do you want to have a go at implementing this?

The code is here.

Replacing the `...` with a unicode elipsis `…` might be sensible too to save 2 characters.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/4ca26eb38cf9befdabc6b6a68a7a320fa247a21f/fs/accounting/accounting.go#L259-L265

I would love too but, if I can read the code, I can't write it, I'm not a
developper.

thanks!

issue.title: change too long names cutting mechanism - fixes #2490

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Fix for the https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2490 issue
I wasn't sure how I should split the visible characters ( quoting the issue description `This ticket is to change the UI to <...> like ThisisATestFile...EndOfFilesName.xxx`) so I implemented the version where a visible prefix is equal or  one character longer than a visible suffix.

body: This is now in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) and will be in v1.44 :-)
